programme.desc: Rich Returns?: After his sacking last series, Rich returns to the shop in a last-ditch effort to win back his job. Seth continues his attempt to takeover the store. (S7, ep 1)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Shocker: An electric chair gives Rich the chance to curry favour with Les. Seth hatches a scheme that could make a fortune for the store. But will it work in practice? (S7, ep 2)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Million Dollar Story: Pawn shop owner Les hears a killer story from a group of clients. But are they to be trusted? Later, he also makes a very important discovery. (S7, ep 3)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Haff-Inated: Allen's off his game without his morning coffee, but some fun items help him re-energise. The guys find a wrestling ring and vintage animatronics. (S5, ep 18)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Brew-Phoria: Ton and Allen go all in for an electric car, but with the batteries missing, a pricey refurb is their only shot at a profit. (S5, ep 19)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Catch My Drift?: The guys land a custom drift car and a luxury antiques unit that could have a one-of-a-kind pilot pistol from WWI. (S5, ep 20)

programme.title: Container Wars
programme.desc: Booby Traps and Safes: A truly enormous auction explodes when rival bidders bet huge sums of money on forfeited international shipping containers. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Alien Apocalypse: If extraterrestrials visited Earth would they enlighten us or destroy us? Experts examine the possibility of a doomsday orchestrated by an alien enemy. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Top Ten Military Encounters: A fascinating and shocking countdown of the top ten military encounters between Earth's armed forces and UFOs. (S3, ep 6)

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The Mystery Of Puma Punku: Experts explore the puzzling construction of Puma Punku in Bolivia. Could advanced technology have been used to carve the ancient temple complex? (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: In 1980, soldiers encounter a luminous craft and dancing red lights in Suffolk. Witnesses report a metallic UFO hovering over water and crashing in Nova Scotia in 1967. (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: A silent football-shaped object causes grave concern when it's spotted in Maine in 1975. In 1946, a UFO crashes and causes a deafening explosion as it crashes in northern Sweden. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Haarp: Are governments around the world using weather control to incite the next World War and possibly destroy the planet? A team of experts investigate. (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Cloning: Animal cloning has been a reality for decades but the disturbing truth is that human cloning may be much closer than you think. (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Bigfoot: Is this half-man, half-ape simply a figment of our collective imagination or does he really exist? Experts ask whether he is being hidden from us and why. (S1, ep 8)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Anti-Christ?: Every culture and religion on the planet believes that an evil one will usher in the end of days. But who is this Anti-Christ? And how can we hope to stop him? (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Rise Of The Machines: We rely on machines for virtually every aspect of modern life. But is technology going too far, too fast? And will humans suffer the consequences? (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Stargate Portals: Discover the locations of stargate portals around the world. Thought to be doorways to wormholes in time, who is battling to open them and why? (S1, ep 11)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Top 10 Conspiracies Of All Time: Discover the secrets surrounding the ten biggest and most mysterious conspiracies in history, including the goings-on at Area 51. (S1, ep 12)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Remote Viewing: A look at the CIA's rumoured investment in psychological operations. Could there be an army of remote viewers watching American citizens today? (S1, ep 13)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Time Travel: Could the ability to travel through time be real? Experts unseal new evidence suggesting this phenomenon of science fiction might not be as far-fetched as it seems. (S1, ep 16)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Secret Government Warehouses: From Fort Knox to Hanger 18 and Camp Hero, discover the shocking truth hidden inside the government's secret and highly-fortified areas. (S1, ep 20)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: Global Depopulation: Many predict a cataclysmic event will soon spell the end of the human race. If disaster struck, is there a way we could save ourselves from extinction? (S1, ep 21)

programme.title: Conspiracy Files Unsealed
programme.desc: America's Flying Saucer: From flying saucers to killer drones, discover the out-of-this-world technology the US military is using to conquer the globe. (S1, ep 22)

programme.title: Digging For Britain
programme.desc: Stone Age Engineering and Battle of Bullecourt: Finds from the East include a monument as old as Stonehenge and some disturbing Roman burials. (3 of 4)

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: Down the Hatch: Rick, Marty and the team make a stunning discovery below the garden shaft that could be the key to solving the Oak Island mystery. (S10, ep 24)

programme.title: New: U-Boat Wargamers
programme.desc: The Wrens: Though the Admiralty are convinced the Allies have the expertise to defeat Germany, Roberts and the Wrens start devising wargaming tactics to combat U-boat formations. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: New: Viking Dead
programme.desc: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde: Roskilde's Viking Ship Museum is one of Denmark's top attractions, proving the interest in these seafaring people remains as strong as ever. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Lost Relic Hunters
programme.desc: The Sword: A look at the most dramatic object in Hamilton and Carl's collection: the Knights Templar sword, which they believe might have been used at the Battle of Acre. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: The Mission
programme.desc: (1986) Award-winning epic with Robert De Niro and Jeremy Irons. A Jesuit priest and a reformed slave trader forge an alliance to protect Indigenous South Americans from colonial Portugal.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: (1967) Western starring Audie Murphy. A cavalry captain tries to protect a wagon train and a shipment of rifles from the Apache Nation. But he faces treachery from within his own ranks.

programme.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street
programme.desc: (1956) Thriller starring Van Johnson as a blind playwright who overhears a kidnapping plot and, with his fianc√©e (Vera Miles) and secretary (Cecil Parker), sets out to trap the villains.

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea
programme.desc: (1955) Creature feature. Kenneth Tobey stars as the captain of a nuclear submarine who comes across a giant, tentacled beast that is fiercely determined to destroy San Francisco.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.
programme.desc: (1966) Raquel Welch - in her famous fur bikini - stars in this prehistoric adventure set in an inhospitable landscape populated by two warring tribes and Ray Harryhausen's roving dinosaurs.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: Nightmare Alley
programme.desc: (2021) Guillermo del Toro's star-studded carny thriller with Bradley Cooper and Cate Blanchett. Can a chancer with a dark past use clairvoyancy to fleece rich New Yorkers out of a fortune?

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: Cold War
programme.desc: (2018) Award-winning drama. A musical director and a singer fall in love but are maybe doomed to be separated by differing loyalties across the Iron Curtain. In Polish/subs. Sexual scenes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help Joselyn Taylor, who has been searching for her elder brother James to find out why she was put in a children's home at two weeks old. James in turn has also been searching for the father he never knew and had only been able to dream about

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Emergency nurses Kat and Becca help student nurse Meredith through her first trauma call, Dulcie looks after a 106-year old who is her oldest patient yet.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Steve is back to finish his game with son-in-law Jordan, hoping to win enough money to get him and step-daughter Megan out of the house and set them up with a home of their own. Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - they've been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers Tracy Thackray-Howitt, Alison Chapman, Fay Rutter and Simon Schneider assess antiques in Swindon

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Playing against each other today are married London couple Jon and Anushka, scuba diving fanatics Jerry and Amy, and Bournemouth couple Kenneth and Raymond. Adil Ray presents

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: In an Oscars special, Adrian from Norwich, Karla from Nottingham, Tim from London and Demi from Carlisle attempt to take down one of the country's finest quiz brains and secure a cash prize. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: April goes back to school, Jacob struggles, and Lydia sees what is going on

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Aston Villa v Cardiff City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Roy Keane and Ian Wright to present coverage of the fifth-round match from Villa Park, where the Premier League team welcome Championship opposition. The Villans progressed to this stage of the competition for the first time in a decade by overcoming fellow top-flight outfit Tottenham Hotspur in the previous round, with Jacob Ramsey and Norgan Rogers netting in a 2-1 win. Meanwhile, the Bluebird were involved in an enthralling encounter away to Stoke City last time out, and after leading 2-1 at half-time found themselves trailing 3-2 just prior to the hour mark, and would eventually go on to prevail in a penalty shootout after finding an equaliser through Rubin Colwill when scoring his second goal of the game. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The bad boyfriends enter the next phase of Olivia's project, 'Forgiveness and Moving Forwards'. Sam and Bayley are left sweating when Olivia asks them to hand over their phones.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: Model and actress Rosie Huntington-Whiteley joins the panel as a guest judge while Britain's best amateur clothing designers compete to win a job as a fashion designer at high street giant M&S. The designers tackle the challenges that come along with Lingerie Week

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to ¬£1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: Judi's next stop is to the Greek seaside town of Parga where she meets Panayiotis and his family at their baker where she tries a traditional Greek coffee and learns to make feta and olive bread. Father and son duo, Kosmas and Giorgos, teach Judi about the many different uses of olive oil and Elinda takes the comedian on a trip around her herb and fruit gardens. Back on the yacht, Judi makes chargrilled vegetables with halloumi and a chilli mint dressing

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Felicity Kendal, Nigel Havers and Jessica Hynes join Alan and Meirion Owen gives a lesson in sheepdog training. Camilla Bassett-Smith and Chris Hull spruce up the green house and Ian Burrell makes rum cocktails for all seasons

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Dan Ryan and Leanne Best into his own home to talk about their roles in the new series of The Bay and trial recipes from chefs Glynn Purnell, Kate Austen and Andres Alemany

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur shares her passion for good food and recipes for an aubergine and potato curry with fresh roti, a salmon and tomato curry and gooey brownies. Plus, a lesson in how to handle alpacas and a visit from a local chainsaw artist

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kelso
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Morebattle Hurdle in Kelso, plus National Hunt racing from Doncaster and Newbury. Analysis comes from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, with reports by Oli Bell and Natalie Green, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: More of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Karim Zeroual, Christopher Biggins, Ellie Leach and Des Clarke pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the revival of the game show in which office manager Shirley, financial management assistant Cameron and police investigation officer Adele compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as more performers take to the stage to try to impress judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and guest judge KSI, and secure their place in the live semi-finals

programme.title: The Brit Awards 2025
programme.desc: Comedian Jack Whitehall returns to host the ceremony for a fifth time, from London's O2 Arena, as the people of the music industry gather to celebrate another 12 months in pop. Those taking to the stage include Sabrina Carpenter, Jade, Myles Smith, the Last Dinner Party, Teddy Swims and Shaboozey

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Alice Ruggles: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: How a young woman was brutally killed by a calculating ex-boyfriend who used social media and the internet to stalk and torment his victim before taking her life in her Newcastle home - with previously unseen social media correspondence between Alice and her friends, family and the perpetrator, this documentary explores how cyberstalking eventually led to murder

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Leeds United v West Bromwich Albion at Elland Road, Oxford United v Coventry City at Kassam Stadium, and Luton Town v Portsmouth at Kenilworth Road, in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay challenges the teams to create a delicious Italian dinner, assigning a kitchen at random to do so.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Lerato Umah-Shaylor and Freddy Forster in the kitchen garden of Blickling Hall in Norfolk to see who can create and cook the Dish Of The Day this time. Ainsley showcases cucumbers picked from the Blickling greenhouse as part of his chicken and cucumber noodle salad, Freddy's background in French cuisine is shown in his sea trout with chilli and strawberry butter sauce, and Lerato brings her expertise in traditional African cooking to a Ugandan rolex

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Eastbourne, where he plays Mum's the Word, the Leaning Tower of Poundsa and brand-new game Escalator Spectator, before finishing the series with one last round of In for a Penny

programme.desc: Philip Glenister, Jenny Agutter and Renee Bailey join Alan in the barn and Dr Bolu Eso meets some famous dog breeds. Jamie Butterworth plants some early spring shrubbery and Becky Paskin makes some Old Hollywood cocktails

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team come to the aid of Penny and Carl in Leeds, whose devotion to looking after wildlife, including an endangered hedgehog, has taken over their garden. The team get to work creating a wildlife-friendly space that will also be suitable for the children to play in, and at the bottom of the garden, David Domoney designs a wildflower meadow complete with hedgehog-friendly pond

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Newcastle United v Brighton & Hove Albion (Kick-off 1.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at St James' Park. Newcastle have defeated two lower-league teams so far in this competition in Bromley and Birmingham City and will be looking to move a step closer to another cup final, having already reached the showpiece match in the Carabao Cup. However, they face a Brighton side who have not always been consistent this term, but can be a threat to anyone on their day, as demonstrated in their 1-0 win here in the Premier League in October. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, reports by Gabriel Clarke, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed game show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Catherine Tyldesley, Levi Roots, Chris McCausland and Rick Wakeman pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the four remaining celebrities take to the ice alone for the first time to fight for a place in the grand final. Diversity performs

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Crime drama set in Morecambe, following police officers as they untangle the complexities of criminal cases while also trying to help the families and individuals caught up in them. DS Jenn Townsend returns to work following her father's death and has to push her own grief aside as she investigates the murder of a young woman

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Oscars Live
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross hosts full coverage of the 97th Academy Awards, joined by guests including actor Jacon Isaacs, broadcaster Mariella Frostrup and film expert Elle Osili-Wood. Jonathan also presents footage from the red carpet at the Dolby Theatre in LA with Ross King, before the live ceremony begins at midnight, UK time, hosted by US TV host and comedian Conan O'Brien

programme.title: War: Would Britain Be Ready? Tonight
programme.desc: In a volatile international climate and following the election of Donald Trump as US president, how well-prepared are our armed forces for any future conflict? Former British soldier Adnan Sarwar reports on the UK's defence strategy, whether its current levels of equipment and manpower are adequate or not, and if the right level of funding is in place to meet the challenges of the future

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help Joselyn Taylor, who has been searching for her elder brother James to find out why she was put in a children's home at two weeks old. James in turn has also been searching for the father he never knew and had only been able to dream about

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Emergency nurses Kat and Becca help student nurse Meredith through her first trauma call, Dulcie looks after a 106-year old who is her oldest patient yet.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: In an Oscars special, Adrian from Norwich, Karla from Nottingham, Tim from London and Demi from Carlisle attempt to take down one of the country's finest quiz brains and secure a cash prize. Bradley Walsh hosts

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: April goes back to school, Jacob struggles, and Lydia sees what is going on

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Aston Villa v Cardiff City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Roy Keane and Ian Wright to present coverage of the fifth-round match from Villa Park, where the Premier League team welcome Championship opposition. The Villans progressed to this stage of the competition for the first time in a decade by overcoming fellow top-flight outfit Tottenham Hotspur in the previous round, with Jacob Ramsey and Norgan Rogers netting in a 2-1 win. Meanwhile, the Bluebird were involved in an enthralling encounter away to Stoke City last time out, and after leading 2-1 at half-time found themselves trailing 3-2 just prior to the hour mark, and would eventually go on to prevail in a penalty shootout after finding an equaliser through Rubin Colwill when scoring his second goal of the game. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The bad boyfriends enter the next phase of Olivia's project, 'Forgiveness and Moving Forwards'. Sam and Bayley are left sweating when Olivia asks them to hand over their phones.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: Model and actress Rosie Huntington-Whiteley joins the panel as a guest judge while Britain's best amateur clothing designers compete to win a job as a fashion designer at high street giant M&S. The designers tackle the challenges that come along with Lingerie Week

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to ¬£1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: Judi's next stop is to the Greek seaside town of Parga where she meets Panayiotis and his family at their baker where she tries a traditional Greek coffee and learns to make feta and olive bread. Father and son duo, Kosmas and Giorgos, teach Judi about the many different uses of olive oil and Elinda takes the comedian on a trip around her herb and fruit gardens. Back on the yacht, Judi makes chargrilled vegetables with halloumi and a chilli mint dressing

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Felicity Kendal, Nigel Havers and Jessica Hynes join Alan and Meirion Owen gives a lesson in sheepdog training. Camilla Bassett-Smith and Chris Hull spruce up the green house and Ian Burrell makes rum cocktails for all seasons

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Dan Ryan and Leanne Best into his own home to talk about their roles in the new series of The Bay and trial recipes from chefs Glynn Purnell, Kate Austen and Andres Alemany

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur shares her passion for good food and recipes for an aubergine and potato curry with fresh roti, a salmon and tomato curry and gooey brownies. Plus, a lesson in how to handle alpacas and a visit from a local chainsaw artist

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Alice Ruggles: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: How a young woman was brutally killed by a calculating ex-boyfriend who used social media and the internet to stalk and torment his victim before taking her life in her Newcastle home - with previously unseen social media correspondence between Alice and her friends, family and the perpetrator, this documentary explores how cyberstalking eventually led to murder

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Leeds United v West Bromwich Albion at Elland Road, Oxford United v Coventry City at Kassam Stadium, and Luton Town v Portsmouth at Kenilworth Road, in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay challenges the teams to create a delicious Italian dinner, assigning a kitchen at random to do so.

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Lerato Umah-Shaylor and Freddy Forster in the kitchen garden of Blickling Hall in Norfolk to see who can create and cook the Dish Of The Day this time. Ainsley showcases cucumbers picked from the Blickling greenhouse as part of his chicken and cucumber noodle salad, Freddy's background in French cuisine is shown in his sea trout with chilli and strawberry butter sauce, and Lerato brings her expertise in traditional African cooking to a Ugandan rolex

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team come to the aid of Penny and Carl in Leeds, whose devotion to looking after wildlife, including an endangered hedgehog, has taken over their garden. The team get to work creating a wildlife-friendly space that will also be suitable for the children to play in, and at the bottom of the garden, David Domoney designs a wildflower meadow complete with hedgehog-friendly pond

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Aston Villa v Cardiff City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Roy Keane and Ian Wright to present coverage of the fifth-round match from Villa Park, where the Premier League team welcome Championship opposition. The Villans progressed to this stage of the competition for the first time in a decade by overcoming fellow top-flight outfit Tottenham Hotspur in the previous round, with Jacob Ramsey and Norgan Rogers netting in a 2-1 win. Meanwhile, the Bluebird were involved in an enthralling encounter away to Stoke City last time out, and after leading 2-1 at half-time found themselves trailing 3-2 just prior to the hour mark, and would eventually go on to prevail in a penalty shootout after finding an equaliser through Rubin Colwill when scoring his second goal of the game. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The bad boyfriends enter the next phase of Olivia's project, 'Forgiveness and Moving Forwards'. Sam and Bayley are left sweating when Olivia asks them to hand over their phones.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe
